result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristin N Wendels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall have no contact with Jacob E.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall submit to random blood, breath, urine or drug screens.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form
Def in person & by Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Argument by counsel; statement by defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on August 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Resolution reached and adjourned sentencing date requested.  Along with a plea to Ct. 1, State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 2, 3 and 4.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Cts. 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Sentencing recommendation placed on record:  3 1/2 years Wisconsin State Prison (18 mos. initial confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision) imposed and stayed; 3 years of Probation; $268 court costs; $250 DNA surcharge and sample; absolute sobriety; no controlled substances without a valid Rx; AODA; other conditions per Agent; no contact with Jacob Eggers; 30 days jail and defense free to argue.  Court admonishes Defendant of bond conditions and adjourns sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on July 21, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Matthew E Weil.  Atty Sandra J Giernoth appeared for State.  Not guilty plea previously entered; defendant has medical issues and has appointment end of June; Atty. Weil requests an adjournment to allow defendant to resolve her medical issues.  Arraignment continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Arraignment on June 12, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Matthew E Weil.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Not guilty plea entered.  Atty. Weil anticipates a plea and DA has extended an offer.  Status hearing requested.  Arraignment continued to June 12, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Per request of Atty. Matthew Weil, 5-07-14 Arraignment rescheduled to 5-16-14 at 8:15 a.m. Atty. Weil to send confirming letter.
Letter from Atty Giernoth
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Arraignment on May 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Co-defendant case.  Counsel's first appearance.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

No contact with JE; Absolute sobriety; Not possess controlled substance without valid prescription
Hearing on April 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya Perez Reyes State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State rqst. $1,000.00 cash bond.  Counsel rqst. lowest cash bond possible.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  SPD will represent.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
